stories.text: As I keep listening to various biology/biotech related podcasts, sometimes the research related information is being intercepted with statements like "...and on the basis of these ground breaking results in yeast/mice/salamanders/axolotls/etc animals/a dozen of patients we founded a company for more in-depth research". There are no mentions about MVPs, business models, interactions with customers, funding, profits etc. I was curious how do such companies whose main activity seems to be the conduction of basic _cutting_edge_ biotech research with still a far goal of a broader application in humans do exist financially. Is it all about just getting a right long-term funding?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do experimental research companies exist financially?
